alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Macon; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 03 at 5:28PM CDT until August 03 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Bullock County in southeastern Alabama... Macon County in southeastern Alabama... Montgomery County in south central Alabama... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 528 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Martin Dam to near Emerald Mountain to near Hunter, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Montgomery, Tuskegee, Union Springs, Notasulga, Meadville, Milstead, Pike Road, Coosada, Shorter, Franklin, Hyundai Motors Of Alabama, Auburn University In Montgomery, Lake Tuskegee, Woodcrest, Snowdoun, Shopton, Tuskegee National Forest, Waugh, Lagoon Park and Hunter. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
